fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when setting up a project that uses several languages, the translations for the project's assets will be provided like the followings(as of Dec 17th):
||Item||How the translated asset is created||
|Issue type|Depending on the default language used, duplicated items for different languages will be created upon project creation|
|Resolution|same as above|
|Status|translation is provided for the existing items automatically|
|Priority|translation isn't provided automatically|

This is making the project administration very confusing for the admin because several different approaches will be needed to set up a single localized project.

h3. Suggested Solution
Align the behaviour for setting up localized items

h3. Note
* If the admin did the followings, different issue types having the same name would appear.
## Set the browser language setting to Japanese
## Create a project with default language set as English
## Create another project with default language set as Japanese
## Add translations for the issue types created in 2
## Access https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/ShowConstantsHelp.jspa
* For issue type, Epic is not created for each languages so it doesn't get duplicated.
fields.summary: Improve i18n experience for project administration

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The welcome page loads a blank page on new Jira instances
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Sign up for a new Jira software
 # Go to the dashboard, you would be redirected to the link ([https://XXXX.atlassian.net/welcome/software)|https://xxxx.atlassian.net/welcome/software)]

h3. Expected Results

The onboarding screen is visible
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
  
h3. Actual Results

A blank screen is visible
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 The below error is seen in the console tab:
{code:java}
Uncaught (in promise) Unable to load bridge "internal/browser-metrics"
{code}
h3. Notes

When the page is scrolled to the bottom, the onboarding details are visible
h3. Workaround

Scroll to the bottom of the page and complete the onboarding
fields.summary: Welcome Page Does Not Load Properly On New Jira Instances

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the name of the project contains special characters, Jira will place this same characters in URLs, which might cause malfunctions.

In a specific example, if the project's name contains the *#* symbol, none of the reports will open (see the video below).

Video:
 [^JRACLOUD-71232.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Insert the *#* symbol in a project's name;
* Navigate to the "report" section and try to open any report.

h3. Expected Results
* The report's configuration opens so that the admin can input the relevant parameters.

h3. Actual Results
* An error ("No report was specified. The 'ReportKey' parameter was empty") flashes and then the page goes blank.

h3. Workaround(s)
* Either remove the special character from the project's name or remove the special character from the URL

If you need help to set up the configuration, please open a support ticket at support.atlassian.com.
fields.summary: Jira doesn't convert special character in the project's name to URLs

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Currently when site admin access a group he/she can see the number of group members which includes system users (e.g add-on users). However, the system users won't be appeared in the group.

This causes confusions as the members count does not match the users appearing in the group if there's any system user among them.

h3. Suggested resolution
* Deduct the amount of system users (which are hidden) from *Group members* in the group.

or

* Allow the visibility of system users in the group
fields.summary: Hide/deduct system users from "Group members" count in groups

fields.description:
# Create a new Workflow with the & added to its name - *& test workflow*
 # Associate *& test workflow* with 'All Unassigned Issue Types'
 # On the *Workflow Schemes* page, click on *& test workflow*:
!Screen Shot 2018-12-14 at 12.05.14.png|width=650,height=91!

h3. Expected Behavior:

The workflow would be displayed.
h3. Actual Behavior:

An error message is shown:
!Screen Shot 2018-12-14 at 12.06.00.png|width=245,height=193!
h3. Workaround:
 * If the workflow is *inactive*, simply edit the workflow and rename it, removing the & character.
 * If the workflow is *active*, create a copy of it changing its name in the process, and associate the workflow scheme to this new workflow.
fields.summary: Not Found Error when viewing Workflow containing name with Special Character (&)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer not able to use a two-factor authentication other than Google, Authy and Duo

h3. Suggested Solution
Customer should be able to use a two-factor authentication other than Google, Authy and Duo

h3. Why this is important
Customers willing  to use a two-factor authentication other than Google, Authy and Duo
fields.summary: Ability to use third party two factor authentication.

fields.description: The ability to define notifications per channel, i.e. separately for emails and in the Jira instance. Some notifications should be sent to emails, but some notifications should only be in the Jira instance, so that users would be able to see when they login to their instance.
fields.summary: Different email notifications for emails and Jira instance

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the new Jira experience, the section to create a new release is at the bottom of the page. In order to create a new release, you must scroll down to the bottom of the page.

h3. Suggested Solution
Switch back to the top.

h3. Why this is important
If the project has too many releases, it's counter-intuitive scroll down passing through every release to create a new one.

- Old layout:
!old-experience.png|thumbnail!

- New layout:
!new-experience.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Switch back the 'new release' section to the top of the page.

fields.description: Would like the ability to add columns to the sprint report, in particular, we are looking to add the Assignee to our sprint reports to create visibility for work accomplished during our sprint demos.
fields.summary: Add assignee column to the sprint report

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When [Managing issue type schemes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/associating-issue-types-with-projects-776636339.html] the migration of 1000+ issue types throws an error 500. The limitation of bulk migrating more than 1000 issues at a time in Jira is not being considered when removing an issue type of the issue type scheme.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
On a project with 1000+ issues of the same Issue Type.
# Issue Types > Edit Issue Types;
# Remove the Issue Type with more than 1000 issues;
# Choose another issue type to migrate the issues;

h3. Expected Results
JIRA shows a progress bar of the migration being done until it successfully completes and displays the result.

h3. Actual Results
An error 500 is thrown with the below error:
 !image002.png|thumbnail! 
{code}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Too many entities. Was: 1799, limit: 1000
.
.
.
{code}

h3.Workaround
Proceed with the migration of the affected issue type using [Bulk Changes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/editing-multiple-issues-at-the-same-time-902498099.html].
fields.summary: Migrating issue type throws an error 500

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
When an add-on is installed the add-on user (system user) will be added to all groups that are set as _default_ in *Application access configuration*. However, removing the add-ons or setting the group as non-default won't remove the system user from the group.

This makes the add-on user (system user) to appear in some user picker fields where it's not necessary!

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a group
# Set the group as _default_ for an application (e.g Jira Software) in *Application access configuration*
# Install an add-on
# The add-on user will be added to the group
# Uninstall the add-on
# Set the group as non-default in *Application access configuration*

The user will remain a member of the group!

h3. Suggested resolution
The user-group membership should be revoked when the add-on is uninstalled, or when the group is set as non-default

h3. Workaround
* Contact Atlassian support at https://support.atlassian.com/
fields.summary: Remove system users from non-default application access groups

fields.description:
The Agile dashboard should contain hyperlinks for issues or projects in the list.

This would help users easily navigate to the issues or projects via the dashboard
fields.summary: Hyperlinks to be included on the Agile dashboard to be able to open the project or the issue directly

fields.description:
Users to be able to add issues in the swim lane, top-down approach.

Currently, the issues can only be added at the bottom of the swimlane.

It would be easier to add the issues from the top as well
fields.summary: To be able to add issues in the swim lane , top down approach

fields.description:
Recent upload under attachment should be discontinued.

This confuses the users with a lot of recent attachments and the right attachment is lost on the course
fields.summary: Recent upload under attachment should be discontinued.

fields.description:
h2. Summary
When issues are exported from Jira as CSV (export all fields), the csv file does not render properly on excel for macbook.

h2. How to reproduce
# Export issues as CSV (export all fields)
# Open the csv using excel spreadsheet on a macbook
 
h3. Expected behavior
The sheet should render properly

h3. Actual results
The sheet does not render properly.

h2. Workaround
Use other csv tools.
fields.summary: Issue export CSV does not render properly in Excel for Macbook

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Jira new issue view, when a user is @mentioned, suggest users list contains duplicate entries. It happens with different users randomly. This creates confusion for the user which entry to select.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create the comment button
# Try @mention different users
# Any random user would show multiple times in the list

 !mention bug.png|thumbnail! 

 !old issue view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected behavior
Users who are being mentioned should appear only once

h3. Actual behavior
Username appears multiple times.

h3. Note
Can only reproduce in new issue view.
fields.summary: @mention a user shows duplicate entries in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
According to our [Configure field layout in the issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configure-fild-layout-in-the-issue-view-961798059.html] documentation, we are rolling out a new classic project feature named *Issue Layout*, so that admins can select and order the fields that will be shown in the New Jira Issue View.

However, this feature seems to work correctly only with *Software* projects, not with *Business* ones.

Video:
 [^JRACLOUD-71210.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* View the short video.

h3. Expected Results
* Either the "Issue Layout" works as expected with business projects, or the "Configure" button in business issues doesn't show at all.

h3. Actual Results
* The "Configure" button shows for business issues, but once an admin click on it, Jira shows a blank screen.

h3. Workaround(s)
* At this moment, there is none.
fields.summary: "Issue layout" project setting not working in business projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As an Admin, I would like to have back - it was removed in the new view for Admin Page - the option to check the user's Project Roles in the instance, by clicking in the available option - as below screenshot.
 !Project Roles.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

Have the option to check the user's Project Roles for the whole instance.

h3. Actual Results

The option was removed in the new user Admin page.
fields.summary: Add Back the Project Role Option in the User Page

fields.description: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-764478441.html
fields.summary: CSV importer instructions don't match new UI
Linked issues from another JIRA instance are not displayed on the issue navigator

fields.description:
If a Jira Cloud site is configured to use only _project roles_ in the permission schemes, project administrators can add users to their projects. 

Please implement a mechanism for users to _request_ membership to existing projects
fields.summary: allow user to request membership to a project

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description

When viewing the list of watchers which includes a renamed user in an issue, the renamed user was seen to be either not showing information or mapped to the wrong user.
* Not showing information -> Avatar is grey icon with username, not display name
* Mapped to the wrong user -> Avatar is shown as different user, together with the display name

And when running the rest api to return watchers, eg:
 * [https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/TEST-1/watchers]

It returned the below for cases where user not showing information:
{noformat}
{"self":"https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/TEST-1/watchers","isWatching":false,"watchCount":1,"watchers":[{"self":"https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?accountId=","name":"username","key":"username","emailAddress":"?","avatarUrls":{"48x48":"https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/d1457b72c3fb323a2671125aef3eab5d?s=48&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fd1457b72c3fb323a2671125aef3eab5d%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D48%26noRedirect%3Dtrue","24x24":"https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/d1457b72c3fb323a2671125aef3eab5d?s=24&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fd1457b72c3fb323a2671125aef3eab5d%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D24%26noRedirect%3Dtrue","16x16":"https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/d1457b72c3fb323a2671125aef3eab5d?s=16&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fd1457b72c3fb323a2671125aef3eab5d%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D16%26noRedirect%3Dtrue","32x32":"https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/d1457b72c3fb323a2671125aef3eab5d?s=32&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fd1457b72c3fb323a2671125aef3eab5d%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D32%26noRedirect%3Dtrue"},"displayName":"TEST User","active":false,"timeZone":"Asia/Shanghai"}]}
{noformat}
Take note that:
 * For emailAddress, it shows as ? instead of the user's email address
 * There is not accountId field being returned
 * The self field returned does not contain accountId as well: [https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?accountId=]

Where the actual result should be something like the one below:
{noformat}
{"self":"https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/TEST-1/watchers","isWatching":false,"watchCount":1,"watchers":[{"self":"https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?accountId=aaaaaaa-bbbb-cccc","name":"username","key":"username","accountId":"aaaaaaa-bbbb-cccc","emailAddress":"abc@example.com","avatarUrls":{"48x48":"https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/d1457b72c3fb323a2671125aef3eab5d?s=48&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fd1457b72c3fb323a2671125aef3eab5d%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D48%26noRedirect%3Dtrue","24x24":"https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/d1457b72c3fb323a2671125aef3eab5d?s=24&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fd1457b72c3fb323a2671125aef3eab5d%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D24%26noRedirect%3Dtrue","16x16":"https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/d1457b72c3fb323a2671125aef3eab5d?s=16&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fd1457b72c3fb323a2671125aef3eab5d%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D16%26noRedirect%3Dtrue","32x32":"https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/d1457b72c3fb323a2671125aef3eab5d?s=32&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fd1457b72c3fb323a2671125aef3eab5d%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D32%26noRedirect%3Dtrue"},"displayName":"TEST User","active":false,"timeZone":"Asia/Shanghai"}]}
{noformat}

For the wrongly mapped user, it returns the result similar to the one above, but for a different user.

h2. Steps to Replicate

There isn't a direct way to replicate this issue. Due to, Atlassian Cloud is deprecating username, hence there is no possibility to change username. However, it affects the users that has username changed prior to that.

h2. Steps to Diagnose

(!) Support engineer only
Run a check on the {{app_user}} table, the user_key and lower_user_name should have different value:
||id||user_key||lower_user_name||
|10189|abc123|123abc|

(i) In the case of wrongly mapped user:
||id||user_key||lower_user_name||
|10189|abc123|123abc|
|10190|123abc|123cde|
Note: the lower_user_name has a similar column value of user_key for another row

Then check what issue user is watcher:
{noformat}
select (ji.pkey||'-'||ji.issuenum) as key, ua.association_type, ua.source_name, ua.sink_node_id
from jiraissue ji, userassociation ua
where ua.sink_node_id = ji.id
and ua.association_type = 'WatchIssue'
and ua.source_name = '<extract from the user_key column from app_user>'
{noformat}
Then run a rest call on the issue retrieving the watcher:
 [https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/TEST-1/watchers]

h2. Expected Result

All values returned correctly

h2. Actual Result

Discrepancy viewing the user information and rest api call

h2. More information

Based on the example given above, the logic for the mapping should be:
* Watcher (abc123) mapped to user_key (abc123) which returns (123abc) that should points to the user with username (123abc)

However, it seems to be having double mapping, hence:
* Case 1: Watcher (abc123) mapped to user_key (abc123) which returns (123abc), and mapped again for user_key (123abc), returning no result
* Case 2: Watcher (abc123) mapped to user_key (abc123) which returns (123abc), and mapped again for user_key (123abc), returning (123cde) which mapped to wrong user (if exist)

h2. Workaround

None found so far
fields.summary: Watchers Mapped Incorrectly for Renamed Users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the default language of the instance is set to Japanese, Pie Chart reports will display the Labels in broken characters.

h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set Default language of the instance to Japanese
 # Set the language in the profile to Japanese
 # Navigate to Reports and create a Pie Chart report using Statistic type Reporter or Assignee, for example
 # The report will show broken characters instead.

h3. Expected Results

Pie Chart report should show the information correctly.

h3. Actual Results

Broken characters are displayed in the Chart. 
  
h3. Workaround

Not available
fields.summary: Pie Chart report shows broken characters when the default language is set to Japanese
/rest/api/3/issue does not allow default assignee by account ID

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Date Time Picker custom field is always being displayed as *Invalid Date* in Safari using the New Issue View.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a *Date Time Picker* custom field.
# Set a value on the field.
# Access the issue using *Safari* with the New Issue View.

h3. Expected Results

The date should be displayed in the field.

Tested with Safari Version 11.0.2 (13604.4.7.1.3), but it also happens with other versions.

h3. Actual Results

It's always displaying the following message, even with a correct date.

 !Date Time Picker.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

If you click on the field the system will display the date properly.

Also, it's possible to use the Old Issue View or a different browser where the field is displayed properly.
fields.summary: Date Time Picker field always shows "Invalid Date" in Safari for Jira Cloud.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Create permission settings so that only a list of users or groups can update or edit Custom field

h3. Why this is important

Allow non Jira admin to be able to update custom field.

Restrict certain groups or users from updating the custom field
fields.summary: Custom Field management permission

fields.description:
h2. Summary

When creating loop transitions (transitions that leave from status *Any status* to status *Itself*), the transition is stacked in a box and cannot be organised freely in the Workflow designer as statuses are.

 !Edit_—_Software_Simplified_Workflow_for_Project_SCRUM_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

After adding several loop statuses, these stacked boxes grow vertically and expands the designer window to which it eventually decreases visibility where you're forced to zoom in to view the names.

This can prove very inconvenient for those using numerous loop transitions in their Workflow.

h2. Proposed solution

Allow the loop transition to be organised and dragged freely in the Workflow designer so they may be organised in a clean fashion that doesn't minimise the overall visibility.


h2. Possible workaround

Use individual Workflows for each Issue type (even if they are identical) in the Project to limit the total number of loop transitions per Workflow.
fields.summary: Loop transitions cannot be organised in the Workflow designer

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Excel download of Time-tracking report is broken


h3. Steps to reproduce the issue:
# Navigate to a Classic Software Project.
# Click on *Reports* >* Time-tracking reports*
# Select the suitable options to generate a report for Fix Version, Issues, Sorting and Sub-tasks inclusion.
# Click on *Next* button. Report is generated
# Now click on *Excel view* on the top right corner to download the generated report in an excel format.

Generated Report on GUI:
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-11 at 3.05.44 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Current result on opening the excel document:
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-11 at 3.05.58 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Expected outcome:
The downloaded excel sheet should open properly like this:
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-11 at 3.10.24 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround:
1. Rename the downloaded file from .csv to .html
2. The html file will look something like this
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-11 at 3.08.44 PM.png|thumbnail! 
3. You can then copy paste it to an excel file to use it.

h3. Suggested Solution
To fix the downloaded excel report to be in a proper format.
fields.summary: Excel download of Time-tracking report is broken

fields.description: When looking at the active sprint in the backlog it gives you a handy summary of story points for the sprint (not started/in progress/done). It would be great if we could see this on the Active Sprint board screen as well as total sprint points for each column.
fields.summary: Show story point column totals on the Active Sprint board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Unable to change Favicon on Jira Cloud if a Custom Favicon has already been uploaded.

_*Steps to reproduce the issue:*_
 # Log into Jira
 # Go to Jira  settings-> System-> Look and Feel
 # Replace the old Favicon with a new one
 # We see that the Favicon does not change after clicking Upload Favicon

*Workaround:*

Remove the Logo From look an Feel option, now try changing the Favicon, the Favicon changes. This is intermittent.
h3. Suggested Solution

After multiple attempts customer was able to change the Favicon. This can be replicated internally.

Changing Favicon from default to Custom goes fine
h3. Why this is important

This causes user inconvenience as we have to update the Favicon multiple times in order to update it.
fields.summary: Unable to Change custom Favicon to another custom Favicon

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Default filters available in Issue and filters section of a Project, reports an error "No issues were found in 'All issues' " when clicked more than once 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Go to 'Project' tab
2. Select a project 
3. Click on 'Issues and Filters' menu 
4. Click on 'All issues' (Make sure project has issues) 
5. Again click on same filter 'All issues' from the left side. 

h3. Expected Results
Display the issues.

h3. Actual Results
Following error message is displayed: "No issues were found in 'All issues' "
 
h3. Notes
Affects a few instances with new issue view

h3.Workaround
# Click on Refresh button available below the error to load the issues again.
#  Disable the new issue view
fields.summary: New issue view search, Issue and filters section of a project reports an error "No issues were found in 'All issues' " when clicked more than once

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Profile language doesn't automatically change when JIRA default language changed. For example , when JIRA default language changed to English from Dutch, user profile did changed to English. However, when user open JIRA , the JIRA UI still showing in Dutch language.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set JIRA default language to Dutch. Make sure the user profile is changed too and she/he view JIRA as Dutch language. 
# Then, change the JIRA default language to English . User profile will changed to English. 

h3. Expected Results
When user open JIRA UI , it will display in English.

h3. Actual Results
When user open JIRA UI, it still display in Dutch language.
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
Change the user profile language to something else and Save it. Then , change it back to English.
fields.summary: Profile language doesn't automatically change when JIRA default language changed

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the value of an issue's workflow state does not exist in the active workflow in use no transition buttons will be present on the issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Currently, we haven't determined a reliable reproduction method but we suspect the following can cause this:

 # Mis-configured CSV imports
 # Mis-configured email creation handlers
 # Workflow migrations

h3. Expected Results

Either this never occurs or JIRA is able to handle this condition gracefully such as an option to move the issue into a valid state
h3. Actual Results

Workflow transitions are missing when viewing the issue
h3. Notes

This is not a new problem and has existed in JIRA for a very long time
h3. Workaround

Move the issue to another issue type then move it back to force JIRA to trigger a workflow remap. If this doesn't work, contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Workflow transitions are missing from an issue view if the issue's workflow state is invalid

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to assign a story to an epic in a next gen project

h3. Environment
* Only replicable in iOS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a next gen project and issue
# Click on ...

h3. Expected Results
Taken from Android:  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Taken from iOS:  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: No Assign to Epic option in iOS
Migrate personal data JQL endpoint returns invalid JQL

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The Environment field is not visible in the new issue view
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability to view the Environment field in the new issue view
h3. Workaround 

Use the old view
fields.summary: Ability To View Environment Field in New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Custom avatars(user, project, etc.) are blurry when viewed on modern hi resolution/density displays

h3. Suggested Solution
* Refine and provide better image optimization services

h3. Why this is important
* High-resolution monitors are more commonplace
* Jira doesn't look as polished/not taking advantage of benefits offered by modern displays
 
h3. Workaround 
* No known workaround
fields.summary: Improve custom avatar image quality on high resolution/density displays

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*Atlassian Update, May 24th, 2019:*
Hello,

This issue is fixed. The project releases page loads correctly if there are quotes ("") in the project name.

Thanks,
Jira product management team
{panel}

h3. Summary

Project's releases page doesn't load if project name contains double quotes.

Error in browser's console:
{noformat}
Unhandled promise rejection TypeError: "e is undefined"
https://jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/versions-page.4c0e74bdface05422b82.7.js:1:2584613
https://jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/vendor.5541a9f57e942abba2e2.7.js:1:504088
https://jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/vendor.5541a9f57e942abba2e2.7.js:1:504233
https://jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/vendor.5541a9f57e942abba2e2.7.js:1:459149
{noformat}

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a Jira Software project and include double quotes in the project e.g. Project "Quotes"
# Go to *Releases* page while browsing the project. Sample URL - https://<instance>.atlassian.net/projects/PQ?selectedItem=com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:release-page
fields.summary: Project's releases page doesn't load if project name contains double quotes

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When looking for a specific inactive owner(user) using the "Search Shared Filters" feature(Settings > System > Shared filters), inactive accounts do not appear as a "suggested" account.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow inactive users to be searched

h3. Why this is important
* A lot of instances have 100+ filters and sometimes there's a need to look for a filter owned by an inactive user.  Finding the desired filter could be difficult
 
h3. Workaround 
* Type the user's username in it's entirety
fields.summary: Search Shared Filters: allow searching for variations of an inactive user's name

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When looking for a specific user using the "Search Shared Filters" feature(Settings > System > Shared filters), the "suggestions" pop-up covers the input text box.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the "Search Shared Filters" page - {{[instance].atlassian.net/secure/admin/filters/ViewSharedFilters.jspa}}
# Start typing the owner's name
# Allow the suggestions to pop-up

h3. Expected Results
* The suggestions box appears below the single user input field

h3. Actual Results
* There is an overlap
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-01 at 8.59.23 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* This happens in the old and new UI
* Tested on Chrome, Firefox, Safari and Internet Explorer 11
* Tested on OS X and Windows 10

h3.Workaround
* No known workarounds
fields.summary: Search Shared Filters: user account suggestions cover "single user" input field when searching

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* "Open issues" is the only filter that runs by default
* Allowing the ability to change the default filter when viewing issues within will help customers stay organized

h3. Suggested Solution
* Add functionality which allows custom filters to be set as the default filter

h3. Why this is important
* In some instances, customers would like to have control over how issues are displayed when looking at a project
 
h3. Workaround
* Create a custom filter and share that filter
fields.summary: Allow custom issue filters to be set as default filter for the issue screen on a project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

* Checking the task off in Clementine doesn’t reach out to Jira to resolve a ticket so the user has to mark the task as done in Clementine and then resolve the ticket in Jira. However, currently, It does work the other way around though. If you resolve something in Jira is should automatically complete in Clementine

h3. Suggested Solution
* Develop the feature to  work on both sides. 

h3. Why this is important
 * Less time consuming.
fields.summary: Update Jira issue when checking the task off in Clementine

fields.description:
h3. The Suggestion

Currently, Jira editor fetches the user's mention from the Site Administration, so let's assume that we have a user called *Dummy User*. Dummy, has a username of *dummy.user* under the Site Administration.

Once Dummy is mentioned in *Confluence*, he is mentioned based on his defined nickname, from the *People Directory*, so everyone calls him *@Big Dummy* (a nickname he defined himself) although, once he is mentioned in *Jira*, he's mention becomes *dummy.user*.
h3. More examples

This is specially impactful for users that are [provisioned via Okta|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/configure-user-provisioning-with-okta-957492956.html], since users provisioned from there are created with an *Unique Identifier* from Okta, and in order to be mentioned, those users need to called out with the UUID, instead of their display names or emails.
h4. Workaround

A workaround for this situation, is to provision the user, delete them on the *Site Administration*, and ask those users to log into the application, this will sync the user with the data from the database and allow Jira to fetch the user's mention based on their Display name, and/or email. _Site administrators would need to reinvite users to the instance to sign up to see this workaround work for them_
fields.summary: Fetch user mention from People Directory instead of Site Administration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, according to our [Search syntax for text fields|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/search-syntax-for-text-fields-764478343.html#Searchsyntaxfortextfields-limitations] documentation, Jira cannot search for issues containing parts of words.

h3. Suggested Solution
Enable Jira to search for issues containing parts of words.

h3. Why this is important
This feature would greatly improve the user experience.

h3. Workaround 
At this moment, there is none.
fields.summary: Enable Jira to search for issues containing parts of words.

fields.description: In the new issue view, one no longer has the possibility to _print_, _Export XML_ or _Export Word_ for a single issue, like in the old issue view
fields.summary: missing print or export single issue in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

When you try to upload an attachment with an invalid character in the New Issue View you get just a generic error that doesn't inform the reason for the error.

We tried to upload a file named *test > attachments.png* and we got the following error.

 !alert new issue view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Suggested Solution*

We should have a similar error as we have in the Old Issue View.

We tried to upload the same file in the Old View and we got a specific error that informed that the issue was related to the *>* character in the name of the file, as you can check down below.

 !alert old issue view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Why this is important*

It's import to inform the user the reason why it was not possible to upload the attachment.
fields.summary: Provide better alerts related to attachments errors in the New Issue View.

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to enforce unique field values for a custom field. 
The goal would be to make sure the custom field, e.g. Serial Number, is not entered for more than 1 issue.
Any attempt to create a duplicate entry should fail with an error.
fields.summary: To enforce unique field values for a custom field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The word Watching is being translated incorrectly
h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the language of Jira to French
 # Go to any issue and look at the Watchers field

h3. Expected Results

The word should be translated to"*_l'observation_*"
h3. Actual Results

The word is translated to "*_lobersvation_*"
fields.summary: Incorrect translation to French of the word Watching

fields.description:
h3. Summary

An error message is displayed when trying to create an issue if the crucible review workflow function is added to the create issue post function.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
 (Optional - If Applicable)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Workflow > Edit
 # Click on the create issue transition > Post function > Add Post Function
 # Select Create Crucible Review Workflow Function > Click the Add button
 # Publish the workflow
 # Go to the Project > Click the create issue button > create

h3. Expected Results

Issue is created
h3. Actual Results
 * Throws the error message:
{code:java}
We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file. {code}

 * Issue is created
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes

There is an overlapping in the workflow post function
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Error When Crucible Review Workflow Function is added to the Post Function

fields.description:
*Show done epics* checkbox is missing for *Epic link* field on new Jira issue view.

*Old Jira issue view*
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-12 at 12.50.24.png|thumbnail!

*New Jira issue view*
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-12 at 12.49.50.png|thumbnail!

*Workaround*
 * Open the issue outside the board or disable the new Jira issue view in *Personal settings*.

!Screen Shot 2018-11-12 at 12.55.31.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Show done epics checkbox is missing for Epic link field on new Jira issue view.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently it is only possible to filter based on issue type, priority and the following events: 

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide further options to filter the notifications sent to Slack channel such as JQL queries.

h3. Why this is important
This will provide further customization and makes the integration richer,  

h3. Workaround 
Currently there is no workaround. 

h3. Notes: 
Please check the internal comment for further details.
fields.summary: Provide further notification filtering options for official Jira Slack integration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Tempo installation is failing

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
#  Try installing the add-on Tempo

h3. Expected Results
Add-on is installed

h3. Actual Results
Installation fails with the error below: {code}Installation failed. Dependencies could not be installed. (The app host returned HTTP response code 401 when we tried to contact it during installation. Please try again later or contact the app vendor.){code}
 
h3. Notes
N/A

h3. Workaround
N/A

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a project role name is longer than 20 characters it overlaps the "Remove" button under the People section of project settings.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a project role longer than 20 characters
# Assign this project role to a user under the People section

h3. Expected Results
The project role name wraps up so it does not overlap the remove button.

h3. Actual Results
Project role name overlaps the Remove button(refer to the attached screenshot).

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, there is no way to verify for duplicate values of date picker fields during Issue creation. 

The *Date Compare Validator* is the closest thing available but it only compares date picker fields in the same Issue being created.

h3. Proposed solution

Add a parameter to the *Date Compare Validator* to compare with other Issues.
fields.summary: Add validator in Workflow for duplicate values in date picker fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to perform a backup, it fails with this error:
!screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Backup Manager*
# Click on "Create backup for Cloud"

h3. Expected Results
Backup zip is generated and a link "Download backup file" is shown on Backup Manager page

h3. Actual Results
It fails with *Export failed (Complete pre-export checks)* error.

*Application logs:*
{code}
ERROR
com.atlassian.jira.security.auth.trustedapps.NoOpTrustedApplicationManager.privacy-safe
TrustedApplicationManager should not be used in vertigo
{code}
{code}
12/4/18
7:17:41.556 AM	
WARN
com.atlassian.jira.baseurl.BaseUrlProviderImpl.privacy-safe
[Limited to 10 per PT1M] TCS and DB have mismatched base URLs: tcsBaseUrl='https://example.atlassian.net'; dbBaseUrl='http://localhost:8080'
{code}

REST API /rest/api/2/issue/id/notify does not support account IDs

fields.description:
The Jira REST API for assigning issues should allow you to assign an issue to the default assignee by specifying "-1", according to the documentation. 

e.g. 

/rest/api/2/issue/<issue_key>/assignee

This works when specifying the assignee by name, but not when specifying the assignee by account ID.
fields.summary: /rest/api/3/issue/assignee does not allow default assignee by account ID

fields.description:
h3. Summary
deactivated user won't appear in the JQL search as suggestion for user selection list fields. 

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to JQL search
# choose a user selection list field such as "*reporter*".
# add the operator "=" 
# You will receive a suggestion of the possible user displayed name and e-mail address. 
# start typing the name of an active user 

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

*  Go to site administration and deactivate that user 

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

# choose a user selection list field such as "*reporter*". 
# add the operator "="
# start typing the "name of the deactivated user" 
# You will not receive a suggestion at all. 
# You can try the displayed name, the username, the email address but you will not receive a suggestion. 

 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* Receive a list of suggested users if the search is valid. 

h3. Actual Results
* The search is valid if you complete the JQL search till the end but at no mean a suggestion will be provided. 
 
h3. Notes:
* Not sure if this may be affected by any of GDPR related policies. 

h3.Workaround
* Currently, there is no workaround for this case.
fields.summary: Deactivated user not suggested for User Selection List Fields JQL search
Exclamation point is incorrectly escaped by text editor in strings such as filepaths

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Cannot create issue after uninstalling [Issue Checklist|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213231/issue-checklist?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] add-on.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install [Issue Checklist|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213231/issue-checklist?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] add-on.
# Create issue from any project - no problem.
# Fully uninstall add-on.
# Create issue will still open 'Create Issue' screen, but when click on 'Create' button, nothing happen.
# Reinstall add-on and can create issue again.

h3. Expected Results
Can create issue right after uninstalling add-on.

h3. Actual Results
Cannot create issue right after uninstalling add-on.

h3. Workaround
Wait a few hours for data to sync-up between Jira and add-on after uninstalling the add-on.
fields.summary: Cannot create issue after uninstalling Issue Checklist add-on

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The customer does not want Group A users to mention Group B users in a project. This happens when one of the groups has clients and would like to restrict them from seeing internal users

h3. Suggested Solution
Customers should be able to restrict Group A users mentioning Group B users in a project

h3. Why this is important
Customers having groups assigned to customers and internal users are not willing to enable the feature of mentioning Group A users through Group B users or vice-versa.
fields.summary: Ability to mention users only of the same group and not others in a project

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Some new next-gen projects don't have the Issue Types feature available and it crashes the project.
Customer is not able to see, add or modify issue types in the affected project.

h3. Expected Results
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-08 at 15.33.50.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-08 at 15.26.20.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Notes
If you try to "force" the issue types URL, like this https://<instance>.atlassian.net/projects/<projectkey>/settings/issuetypes
You'll see this error:
{code}
Error
No project could be found with key '<projectkey>'.
Click here to see a list of all the projects
{code}


h3. Workaround
Contact Atlassian support to apply the fix.
fields.summary: Issue Types are not available for some next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The endpoint _*/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta*_ is presenting a degraded performance on Jira cloud
h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
#  Try to perform a POST or PUT on the endpoint _*/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta*_

h3. Results
In some cases, the requests to this endpoint might take more than 60 seconds ending in a timeout
fields.summary: Scalability problems on the endpoint - /rest/api/2/issue/createmeta

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the New Jira Issue View, while viewing an issue, if the *issue type* field is not mapped to the screen used by the edit issue operation for the relevant issue type, when an user tries to change the issue type, Jira will show a message that the issue type was changed, but it actually won't change.

Video:
 [^JRACLOUD-71144.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* View the short video.

h3. Expected Results
* Jira warns the user that the issue type could not be changed or Jira doesn't allow the issue type to be changed at all.

h3. Actual Results
* Jira warns the user that the issue type was changed, but actually it was not.

h3. Workaround(s)
* Map the "issue type" field to the screen used by the edit issue operation for the relevant issue type. To achieve this:

# Type the *g* key twice on your keyboard (gg) or, as alternative, your *period* key ( *.* ), then *Projects*;
# Find the relevant project, click the *ellipsis (...)* icon on your right corner, then *Project settings*;
# Click *Screens* on your left sidebar;
# Expand the screen scheme used by the relevant issue type, then click on the *name* of the screen used by the "Edit issue" operation;
# On the *Select Field ...* dropdown menu, select the "issue type" field.

If you need help to set up the configuration, please open a support ticket at support.atlassian.com.
fields.summary: When viewing an issue with the New View, Jira will warn users that the issue type was changed, but it hasn't

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to generate backup

h3. Environment
* Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the Jira instance
# Try to generate a backup

h3. Expected Results
The backup will be generated successfully.

h3. Actual Results
The export fails with the following error:
{code}
Export error
* Export failed (Starting export)

Please try again later or contact support if error persists
{code}

h3. Workaround
Create a new user with the *sysadmin* username.
fields.summary: Unable to generate backup

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Jira displays a renewal quote message stating that the subscription will expire in 30 days, even though it won't.

This affect annual subscriptions.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As a site admin, login to Jira (where the instance is on annual subscription).

h3. Expected Results

No expiration message should be displayed.
h3. Actual Results

The following message is displayed for site-admins:
 !renewal.jpg|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Misleading renewal quote message being displayed

fields.description:
Allow customers to choose the columns of their issue list.

Fields which are available to them in the issues should be in scope.

Thank you for evaluating this request
fields.summary: Allow customers to choose the columns of their issue list

fields.description:
Customers would like to export their issues.

Thank you for investigating this request.
fields.summary: Allow customers to export their issues (separate or list)

fields.description:
We received the request from one of our customers to be able to filter on workflow status.

At this time, this is only possible to filter on open or closed issues.

Thank you for taking the time to investigate this.
fields.summary: Allow customers to filter on workflow status

fields.description:
We noticed that the button to add mail handlers is no more showing up.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Direct link: [[https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/IncomingMailServers.jspa]]

Note: check internal comment for further details.
fields.summary: Not possible to create mail handlers on Jira cloud sites
The /rest/api/3/search endpoint does not return comments and worklog comments as HTML even if we pass parameter expand=renderedFields. Everything works fine using the v2 endpoint

fields.description:
When changing the language to English(UK), the Versions on JSW shows the status "De-Released" instead of "Unreleased". Based on customers' feedback on this question https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/On-Jira-Cloud-all-unreleased-Versions-have-changed-status-to/qaq-p/946291 this word does not exist.
Searching on Google, it does not recognize as well, it always shows results as "released" or "unreleased".
Please, change the translation back to "Unreleased".
fields.summary: Jira translation for "Unreleased" is incorrect when using English(UK)

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Currently, it is necessary to provide the path to a local file when creating attachments via REST API:
{code}
curl -D- -u admin:admin -X POST -H "X-Atlassian-Token: no-check" -F "file=@myfile.txt" http://https://your-domain.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/TEST-123/attachments
{code}

If you have files hosted on a different location (not locally), you need to download it so you can post it via REST API.

h3. Suggestion

Add the ability to provide an URL as the path to the file (e.g. an image in Google images) so the attachment will be created from the URL.
fields.summary: Ability to create attachments via REST API by providing an URL as attachment's path

fields.description: Jira names development projects a "Software project". This may be often true, but not always. At imec we have a number of hardware development projects that use Jira and the cringe at the mention of "Software project". Perhaps a better name would be "Development project"
fields.summary: Rename "Software project" to "Development project"

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Currently when it comes to video encoding for mp4 videos, most browsers support only  H.264/MPEG-4 AVC . Other encoding however like MPEG-4 Part 2/MPEG-4 Visual is not supported. When attempting to load unsupported video encoding, user will see only a black screen despite the embedded video player in the website is already playing.

It will be great if there is a notice that alerts user of the browser incompatibility since many do not know that only certain video encoding are supported and can be played in browsers.
fields.summary: JIRA should show a notice when the attached video cannot be played due to browser incompatibility

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The page is greyed out after selecting the field in the where is my field feature

h3. Environment
* Replicable in every browser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on Edit
# Click on Where is my field
# Select field

h3. Expected Results
Able to see the status of the field

h3. Actual Results
The page is greyed out

*Application logs:*
No error on the log and console log

h3.Workaround
# Go to the issue
# Click on Admin > Where is my field
fields.summary: Where is my field feature is no longer working in the Edit Screen

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
 - As a Jira user I want the resolved date column to be added to the report. 

Currently, it is hard to view the resolved date. 

At the moment, the user needs to click per issues to view the resolved date value.  

!image-2018-01-03-18-29-07-661.png|width=532,height=120!

h3. Suggested Solution
Similarly to the resolved date, as user I want to add a column for reporter and a column for due date for example. 

h3. Why this is important
The report will provide further details which prevents time loss.

h3. Workaround 
Currently, as a Jira user I need to click on the issue key and access the link to see the data through the Jira issue view.
fields.summary: Customize/add Columns in (Single Level Group By Project) -Report

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Increase the Jira Rest API Pagination value from 100 to 1000

h3. Suggested Solution
Increase the Jira Rest API Pagination value from 100 to 1000

h3. Why this is important
Get request to search issues, worklog, changelog, are paginated to 100 results per search.
When there are more than 100 results, the users would have to run the API command multiple times( at times more than 50). Which is tedious and time-consuming.

It would be nice to increase the pagination value from 100 to 1000 for Jira.
fields.summary: Increase the Jira Rest API Pagination value from 100 to 1000

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Blank sidebar menu when viewing JSD tickets using <instance>/browse/<ISSUEKEY> URL when Nav v2 enabled


h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Confirm you can resize the left menu bar which confirms nav v2

Direct link
# Browse directly to any JSD ticket with the following URL format https://<instance>/browse/<ISSUEKEY>
# Notice the left hand menu is blank

Issue Navigator Search

# Search for a JSD ticket from Issue Navigator
# Click on the ticket - the issue navigator menu is still visdible
# Click the issuekey breadcrumb to view the ticket directly
# Notice the left hand menu is blank

Quick Search

* Same results when using the magnifying quick searach to find a JSD request

h3. Expected Results
* Either the Service Desk menu is shown, or the standard Core menu shown when a user does not have Service Desk Agent project role
* Or just not blank, the only navigation choices are Home, search or create issue


h3. Actual Results
* A blank menu is displayed
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
Use the Queues menu to find JSD tickets
fields.summary: Blank sidebar menu when viewing JSD tickets using <instance>/browse/<ISSUEKEY> URL when Nav v2 enabled

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Create screen required when cloning an issue in Jira.

h3. Suggested Solution
Currently cloning the issue directly creates a duplicate copy of the issue. But the users would require to provide more information on the issue while creating it.
Adding a create screen will help in this situation.

h3. Why this is important
We do have plugins( Deep clone ) which help with the request. But the customers do not wish to install the plugin due to cost constraints.
Also, this feature is available in many other ITSM tools. It would be an added advantage of the  feature is added in Jira
fields.summary: Create screen required when cloning an issue in Jira

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Currently, when using the new issue view and searching for a label that has special characters, the autocomplete does not find the label the same as it worked on the old view, it only shows to create a new label.

h3.Steps to Replicate
# Create a label starting with a special character. '+Helpdesk' for example.
# Try searching for the '+Helpdesk' label in the old issue view. It will return the label as suggestion. 
!OldView.png|thumbnail!
# Now try searching the same label again in the new JIRA issue view. It will prompt the user to create the label instead. 
!NewView.png|thumbnail!

h3.Expected Behavior
Label with special character at the start should be suggested regardless of old or new issue view.

h3.Current Behavior
Only old issue view is returning the label.

h3.Workaround
Change to old JIRA issue view to label the ticket.
fields.summary: Labels that starts with a special character does not show on the new issue view

fields.description:
I have a simple JQL query:

{{project = PSW AND sprint not in futureSprints() AND type in standardIssueTypes() ORDER BY sprint DESC}}

But the results are not ordered in the way I would expect.

It shows me the issues from Sprint 15, then from Sprint 13, Sprint 11, Sprint 2, Sprint 1, Sprint 0, Sprint 14.

However, the sprint start and sprint end dates correspond to the sprint numbers. And the sequence of the sprints we had historically corresponds to the sprint numbers in our sprint titles. 

I also checked the SprintID in the URL and it the ID for "Sprint 13" = 18, the ID for "Sprint 14" = 19. So, the ORDER BY does not follow SprintID either. 

Can somebody explain me the logic behind ORDER BY Sprint in JQL? 

What secret field do you use to order by Sprints? 

How can I make the issues to be ordered by the sprints in the historical sequence?
fields.summary: ORDER BY Sprint does not work properly in JQL in Jira

fields.description: Currently, there is no integration available and also there are no third-party add-ons are available for this.
fields.summary: Need integration for Nexpose Vulnerability Scanner/insightVM  to Jira Cloud

fields.description:
Current Problem
Assignee badges located on an active board can become cumbersome to scroll through if there is a large team using one board. Currently, I am able to type in a name of a user and the issues in the board filter for anyone assigned (which is good). 

The unfortunate issue is that the assignee pick next to the board search text box does not filter also, _so imagine if I had 100 assignees in one board, I type in "chris", and 20 chris' assigned to issues in the board are filtered. The problem I have is that I know what his profile icon looks like but not his last name or what he is working on._ 


Suggestion
My suggestion would be to filter the assignee icons at the same time as when a user is typing into the board search text box.
fields.summary: As a Board Admin, I would like the search text box located above an active board to filter the user badge picker beside it as I type so as to not waste further time trying to find a particular assignee

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it's not possible to further customize the "view on wallboard" dashboard option.

h3. Suggested Solution

Have the ability to further customize the options of the view on wallboard option.
fields.summary: Ability to customize the wallboard view

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition: 

In the new issue view the user doesn't have the option *Export this issue in another format* as it was available in the old issue view.
 # Select a project.
 # Chose *Issues and filters*.
 # Select an issue.

!newissueview.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solutions:

Create for the new issue view a way to export in another format.
h3. Workaround:

Create a search JQL like *Issuekey = NP-6* (example), in *Search issues* and export.
 # Navigate to *Issue and filter*.
 # Select *Search issues*.
 # Write a *JQL like Issuekey = NP-6*.
 # Export in *Export this issue in another format*.

 !img.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Export ticket details in new issue view

fields.description:
h4. Summary
In new navigation in Jira, *Mail* navigation item is duplicating and appearing twice. It's replacing *Admin Helper* menu category.

 !2018-11-26_11-03-55.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Go to JIRA Administration -> System -> General Configuration ->
# Check for *Mail* navigation item, it's appearing twice

h4. Expected behavior
Navigation item *Mail* should appear once only

h4. Actual behavior
The *Mail* navigation item is appearing twice

h4. Note
It's only reproducible in new navigation in Jira.
fields.summary: Navigation item (Mail) duplication in new navigation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the old issue view, the Jira Share Button was a feature that allows a user to share issue by emailing other users. 

This encouraged communication and collaboration among teams.

The ability to share an issue with another user gives a quick method to compel another user to look at an issue that may be pertinent to them. 

You can additionally add a short comment to the user without the need to mention@ them publicly on the Jira issue itself. 

h3. Expected Results

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* Share button not found. 
 
h3. Notes
I couldn't find a reference whether removing this feature was intended so I considered this a bug. 

h3.Workaround
# use old issue view
# use old issue view
fields.summary: New issue view doesn't provide the Jira Share Button

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description
 (!) This only happens to the *New Jira Issue View*
 * When an image is indented by bullet point or numbers, it is not showing when the issue card is opened from a board

h3. Steps to Replicate
# Create an issue and add a comment containing indenting characters and images. This comment should contain an indenting character followed by an image in the line right below it
{quote}
* The image below will not be seen:
 !Cog.png|thumbnail! 

# This image will also not be seen:
 !Cog.png|thumbnail! 
{quote}
  !Screen Shot 2018-11-23 at 6.10.02 PM.png|thumbnail!
 # Go to the board view and click the issue card:
  !Screen Shot 2018-11-23 at 6.10.49 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Result:
 * Image will be displayed on comment:
!Screen Shot 2018-11-23 at 6.17.09 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Actual Result:
* Image is not displayed:
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-23 at 6.11.07 PM.png|thumbnail!  


h3. Workaround
 - To turn off the new Jira issue view:
 # Click on your user *profile picture* at the lower left corner
 # Select *Personal Settings*
 # Under *Jira labs*, click on the tick box to *disable the view*

(!) Alternatively, you can add a new line in between, so the image is not indented
fields.summary: Inline Image Not Showing After Indenting On Issue Card

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description:
 * When creating multiple issues through the API using the */rest/api/2/issue/bulk* endpoint, there is no meaningful information returned in the response body if the request fails unexpectedly. This makes it hard to understand what has worked and what failed to be executed in this request.

h3. How to reproduce:
 * Run an API request using the */rest/api/2/issue/bulk* endpoint. If, for some reason, the request fails somewhere throughout its progress (i.e. due to a database exception), the response returned *does not* contain any information about what issues could have been created and what issues failed.

h3. Expected behavior:
 * Response body should contain details about the issues that were successfully created before the request failed

h3. Actual behavior: 
 * Response body only contains the error message.

h3. Impact:
 * This makes it hard to know what has and has not worked in the request. In a scenario where the request needs to be retried, running the same request one more time may cause duplicate issues being created.
fields.summary: Lack of meaningful response returned for failed REST API request
Jira import fails due to upgrade task

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
We've confirmed that this bug isn't specific to the Portfolio add-on and occurs when attempting to install any add-on to the users affected.
{panel}

h3. Summary
Unable to install Portfolio add-on on the new apps page:

 !new_apps.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
* New app page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to apps > Find New Apps > Portfolio for JIRA

h3. Expected Results
Able to install Portfolio

h3. Actual Results
Error in console log:

{code}
tracker.js:13 installAddon was rejected by the SPI and returned the following message:  {} installableAppId=r { type: "KEY", key: "com.radiantminds.roadmaps-jira" }
{code}
fields.summary: Unable to install Portfolio on the new Addon page
Calling the REST API v3 endpoint to create an issue (rest/api/3/issue) returns '400 - bad request' error

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There is a requirement when using the CSV *bulk issue import* feature that the fields you wish to be populated during the import are present in the relevant *Create Issue Screen*.

However, when importing issues from a CSV via the *bulk issue import*, if you validate the import no notification is made if the fields you wish to be populated are not present on the relevant *Create Issue Screen*. 

Instead what happens once the import is complete the issues are reported to be imported without error, however, the fields that were not present on the create issue screen are not populated with the data from the CSV. 

As the reason for the data not being populated may not be immediately obvious that can cause a significant amount of time to be spent troubleshooting to discover the reason for the fields not being populated.

h3. Suggested Solution
Validate all mapped fields are present on the *Create Issue Screen* that would be used to import this issue. 

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Bulk Issue CSV Import: Validate fields being mapped from CSV are included in the icreate issue screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

So far if you select custom dates on a JIRA Service Desk Report you are only able to take select the past 366 days, based on the actual date. This it would be an enhancement from the feature JSDCLOUD-147 which has been implemented recently.

For example, in November we can't get reports from January, past year. It would be nice to have the ability to go back further than the past year.
h3. Workaround

Depending upon on the business requirements we can use a filter instead. The below filter returns all the tickets which have been resolved in the past year, for example:
{code:java}
resolved >= startOfYear("-1") and resolved <= endOfYear("-1") order by resolved asc
{code}
fields.summary: Add the ability to select a custom date over past years on Jira Service Desk Reports

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When viewing a parent issue through the New Jira issue detail view, it is not possible to choose the information that appears in the sub-tasks cards.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability for users to to choose the information that appears in the sub-tasks cards.

 !sub-tasks cards.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important
This should enhance greatly the user experience.

h3. Workaround 
There is none.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to choose the information displayed in the sub-tasks cards when viewing the parent

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the New Jira Issue View, when the ScriptRunner is installed, it creates a blank shortcut in the app ellipsis menu.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install ScriptRunner in your Jira Cloud instance;

h3. Expected Results
* The app creates a functional shortcut in the app ellipsis menu.

 !functional shortcut.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* The app creates a blank shortcut, which is not functional.

 !Not functional shortcut.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround(s)
* At this moment, there is none.
fields.summary: In the New Jira Issue View, the ScriptRunner app adds a blank shortcut
